abstract: The Tesla co-founder reflects on his portrayal in "Revenge of the Electric Car," a documentary by the filmmaker Chris Paine opening in New York and Los Angeles on Friday.
snippet: The Tesla co-founder reflects on his portrayal in "Revenge of the Electric Car," a documentary by the filmmaker Chris Paine opening in New York and Los Angeles on Friday.

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Chevrolet Division of General Motors Corp

lead_paragraph: "The director, Chris Paine, called me up one day and wanted to have lunch," said Elon Musk, the Tesla Motors chief executive, in a recent telephone interview. He was discussing how he came to be featured prominently in Mr. Paine's new film, "Revenge of the Electric Car," which opens in New York and Los Angeles on Friday after having made the film festival rounds this year. A review of the film appeared in The Times on Friday.

headline.main: As Documentary Rolls Out, Elon Musk Considers His 'Revenge'
